10576.title: suit
10576.credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Janney

extended_text.content:
Artist’s Statement

This work was woven on a 1904 mechanical Jacquard loom at the Rhode Island School of Design. The potentials of creating and delineating specific graphic forms or images with this type of loom, fascinated me then and continue to do so today. The series of which this piece is one was the beginning of my current work, which uses JacqCAD, a sophisticated software program.

-Cynthia Schira

76038.title: Fish Bait
76038.credit_line: Gift of Dr. Steven Conant in memory of Mrs. H. L. Conant and Mrs. H. E. Conant
76038.medium_support: color woodblock print on cream wove paper
76038.provenance: Dr. Steven Conant, Indianapolis, Indiana; given to the Indianapolis Museum of Art in 2012.

extended_text.content:
In May 1915, Mars and Squire were at Mars’ parents’ home in Decatur, Illinois when they received postcards from their friends Ada Gilmore and Mildred McMillen telling them how much they were enjoying Provincetown and inviting them to come, which they soon did.

Mars was among those devoting themselves to woodblock printing through that summer and into the winter when the innovative single-block, white-line color print was created. Mars, however, largely remained true to the multiple-block tradition in works such as Fish Bait.
extended_text.title: Gallery Label

76038.exhibit_history: Provincetown, Indianapolis Museum of Art, Indianapolis, IN, 05/18/2012 - 11/11/2012
